Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung by OSPAAL
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung by OSPAAL 
    Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- A floral basket was placed with due ceremony before the portrait of President Kim Il Sung in the building of the Organization of Solidarity of the Peoples of Africa, Asia and Latin America in Cuba on Oct. 11 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 Present there were the director of the Political Department and members of the organization, the director general of the magazine Tri-continental, the DPRK ambassador to Cuba and staff members of embassy.    
 The participants laid a floral basket before the portrait of the President and paid tribute to him.

articles.title: Withdrawal of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Urged
articles.content:
Withdrawal of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Urged 
    Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The National Association of University Newspaper Journalists of south Korea reportedly conducted an opinion poll as regards the lapse of 60 years since the U.S. military occupation of south Korea among students of 11 universities across south Korea including Kangreung National University, Yeongnam University and Hannam University from September 16 to October 4.
 The results of the opinion poll showed that an overwhelming majority of those polled strongly urged the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea.
 50 percent of the pollees said what come to their minds first is the murder of Hyo Sun and Mi Son, when mentioning the word "U.S. forces," and 73.4 percent of those polled replied that the purpose of the U.S. forces' occupation of south Korea was for U.S. domination and interference. 
 More than half of the pollees charged that the U.S. forces in south Korea are being relocated in the interests of the United States, holding that the U.S. forces' relocation requiring the south Korean "government" to bear all the expenses unilaterally should be totally reexamined.

Chinese Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers in Harvesting
articles.content:
Chinese Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers in Harvesting 
    Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe and embassy officials gave helping hands to the farmers of the DPRK-China Friendship Thaekam Cooperative Farm in Sunan District, Pyongyang, in harvesting on Oct. 14.
 They helped the farmers in carrying rice sheaves as they were working hard to gather even a grain of rice and maize in time without losing them.
 During break the guests talked with officials of the farm, deepening the friendly feelings.    
 We are pleased to have a chance to work at the friendship farm which has striven to do this year's farming well under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il, the ambassador said, wishing the farmers many successes in the agricultural production in the future.

Former Indonesian President Leaves
articles.content:
Former Indonesian President Leaves
    Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Former President of Indonesia Megawati Soekarnoputri, general chairwoman of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, and her party left here Saturday after winding up their visit to the DPRK to congratulate the Workers' Party of Korea  on the 60th anniversary of its foundation. 
 They were seen off at the airport by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and other officials concerned, Bambang Irawan Kromodimuljo, charge d' affaires ad interim of the Indonesian embassy here, and staff members of the embassy.    
 Megawati and her party visited the Taean Friendship Glass Factory and the West Sea Barrage on Friday.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
    Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly led by its Vice-Chairman Kang Nung Su left here today to visit the Czech Republic and a delegation of the Korean Christians Federation led by its Chairman Kang Yong Sop to visit Germany. 
 Meanwhile, a delegation of the Thai Rak Thai Party led by Krasae Chanawongse who is adviser to Thai Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra who is the leader of the party arrived here today.
